quotes.quote: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.
Illusion is the first of all pleasures.
Illusion is needed to disguise the emptiness within.
Illusion is an anodyne, bred by the gap between wish and reality.
With true beauty, there is no illusion.
The illusion that times that were are better than those that are, has probably pervaded all ages.
The one person who has more illusions than the dreamer is the man of action.
It is an illusion that youth is happy, an illusion of those who have lost it.
All illusion comes and goes, but the soul remains unchanged.
Animation is about creating the illusion of life. And you can't create it if you don't have one.
Illusion begets and sustains the world; we do not destroy one without destroying the other.
There's no point in clinging to illusions.

Illusions commend themselves to us because they save us pain and allow us to enjoy pleasure instead. We must therefore accept it without complaint when they sometimes collide with a bit of reality against which they are dashed to pieces.
We must select the illusion which appeals to our temperament and embrace it with passion, if we want to be happy.
A pleasant illusion is better than a harsh reality.
Illusion is no longer possible, because the real is no longer possible.
Limits, like fears, are often just an illusion.
One day everything will be well, that is our hope. Everything's fine today, that is our illusion.
Nothing except a positive illusion can possibly have a future,

There are two kinds of illusion, the negative illusion which merely fails to be a reality, and the illusion which exists as a potentiality or model in the mind, as a fiction which does not yet exist but may be brought into existence or realized by a creative mind.
If the human race were to destroy both itself and the planet it lives on, that would be the final triumph of illusion.
Surely, living in an illusion is the greatest of torments, and becoming disillusioned ought to feel like being let out of jail.
The mystic finds, at the heart of the illusion of space, a real presence.
You too must not count overmuch on your reality as you feel it today, since, like that of yesterday, it may prove an illusion for you tomorrow.
Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow.
Every age is fed on illusions, lest men should renounce life early and the human race comes to an end.
Illusion is always based on reality, for its strength depends upon its fit with the desires, fears and experiences of countless humans.
Rob the average man of his illusion and you rob him of his happiness at one stroke.
A man loses his illusions first, his teeth second, and his follies last.
The notion that as a man grows older, his illusions leave him is not quite true. What is true is that his early illusions are supplanted by new, and to him, equally convincing illusions.
The eyes are not responsible when the mind does the seeing.
It isn't safe to sit in judgment upon another person's illusion when you are not on the inside. While you are thinking it is a dream, he maybe knowing it is a planet.
No man will be found in whose mind airy notions do not sometimes tyrannize, and force him to hope or fear beyond the limits of sober probability.
It appears to me that almost every man may, like the spider, spin from his own inwards his own airy citadel.

For what we call illusions are often, in truth, a wider vision of past and present realities—a willing movement of a man's soul with the larger sweep of the world's forces—a movement towards a more assured end than the chances of a single life.
The key, during both life and death, is to recognize illusions as illusions, projections as projections, and fantasies as fantasies. In this way we become free.
We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
More than any other American sport, baseball creates the magnetic, addictive illusion that it can almost be understood.
The American Dream became America's god; wealth and abundance have become the measure of America's success. But—as recent events have shown— we have been living an illusion.
The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
Certainly generally is illusion, and repose is not the destiny of man.
We live in the illusion that we are all separate 'I ams.' When the fog finally clears, we shall know there is only One.
Some seem as alive, / But seem as died, / Some seem as died, / But seem have lives, / It can not realize, / By an ordinary eye.
Now freedom in the world / Just as like as illusion / Modern slavery called freedom / No one can claim it / No one can have it.
Only the Knower knows / That music cannot be written / How can then be the notes / Says Kabir, awareness alone will overcome illusion.

Since I am a poet / I express it in exact words, / Which illustrate a truth / And reality / However, it can be an illusion, / Far from the facts / But the direct narration / With a direct figure / It verifies the truth and reality.
It wasn't love, it wasn't love / It was a perfect illusion (perfect illusion) / Mistaken for love, it wasn't love / It was a perfect illusion (perfect illusion) / You were a perfect illusion.

No baby this is not an illusion / I've really got my heart out on my sleeve / Oh baby this is not an illusion / There's magic between you and me / No baby this is not an illusion / You really got me lifted off 'my feet / So tell me you believe in love /  'Cause it's not an illusion to me.
